page.title: 01Upper Arkengarthdale
page.content: This high dales valley cuts diagonally from NW to SE through high heather moor land. Above Low Faggergill the valley is wide, wet, rough grassland, used for grazing sheep. Below, the valley contains many small fields of grass used for both sheep and cows. People live in small isolated farmhouses. As there is no shortage of stone, field walls and houses all have thick walls. Whaw is the only community in the block and is a hamlet of 8 to 10 homes including 2 farms. Homes are mainly occupied by local farm workers, although some have been renovated and are used as holiday homes. The valley has lots of footpaths which are regularly used by holiday makers and day visitors.
